bug.short_desc: The zoom keystrokes have gotten mangled

assigned_to.name: Nobody; OK to take it and work on it

long_desc.thetext:
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.5; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0 Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.5; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
The "View > Zoom" menu item lists "Zoom In" as cmd-'+' and "Zoom Out" as cmd-'-'. However, on my new install of FF 4.0, cmd-'-' is doing a "Zoom In" and I have no idea how to do a "Zoom Out".
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Browse to a web page. 2. Hold down the command key. 3. Press the "-" key. Actual Results: Text should get smaller.
Expected Results: Text gets bigger.

works fine for me Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.5; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
"Zoom In" (cmd-'-') and "Zoom Out"(cmd-'+') and Reset(cmd-'0') keyboard short cuts works as expected.
Could you please check if any add-ons are installed and also Please try if you can reproduce it:
1.in safe mode. https://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Safe+Mode
2.or by creating a new profile https://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Managing+profiles#Creating_a_profile.
Please update if you still able to reproduce this issue.
It appears to have been either transient or a cockpit error.
